name: SPIN CRYPT Halloween Demo
description:
"Every year, on Halloween, people find candy in here. Some say it's the groundskeeper, leaving treats for rowdy kids. Others think it's the cemetery itself, luring people in."

Welcome to Spin Crypt! This is a short proof-of-concept for a project I've been working on for a while now, and while I haven't made it very far in the actual project I wanted to make use of the "engine" I finally got set up (and also actually have a game to release for once)!

Explore three colorful locations within a graveyard filled with pitfalls, ghosts, unusually large lightbulbs, and pumpkins on Halloween night, all while searching for as much candy as you can! It's based heavily on classic handheld Zeldas, but less focus on action-RPG aspects, and more on platforming. (It gets kinda difficult by the end)

Controls are escape for pause, arrow keys + Z & X, you can change Z -> C in the 'controls' section of the game's menus if you like. The project also has gamepad support, but there isn't binding customization, so hope you get lucky with your button mapping.
